title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Lys [Lillies], from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service], 1821–24
title_raw: Plate Design:  Les Lys [Lillies], from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service]
medium:
Pen and brown/black ink, brush and wash, white gouache, graphite on pink/tanpaper mounted on blue/gray paper
Support: paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and blue ink on mount, lower center:  Les Lys; in graphite by later hand: culture des fleurs
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer A. Samuels, New York.
description: Scene in front of a church, possibly on Assumption Day (August ).  A procession of parishners file out of the church, right background, led by acolytes holding banners with images of the Virgin.  In the right middleground, a group of three women receive lily branches (a Virgin symbol) from a man, center middleground, who is distributing the flowers from a planted terrace.  A young  boy, behind the man, smells a lily; another boy, left middleground, observes the scene from the top of a brick wall that is decorated with the French coat of arms.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Lys [Lillies], from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service], 1821–24. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and wash, white gouache, graphite on pink/tanpaper mounted on blue/gray paper
Support: paper. 
1989-13-1
